KnowledgeBase.Title: substringCiNE
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: compare string equal boolean case-insensitive substring

Function.Description: The substringCiNE function performs a case-insensitive comparison between two substrings and determines whether both substrings are equal or not. A Boolean value is returned.

Brief.Overview: The substringCiNE function performs a case-insensitive comparison between the two substrings {string1 start1 end1} and {string2 start2 end2}. If the substrings are not equal true is returned; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: Use the substringCiNE function to compare if two substrings are not equal without considering the case the of the Strings (case-insensitive). Therefore the Strings "Hello" and "HELLO" would compare equal.

Syntax.Expression:
(substringCiNE string1 start1 end1 string2 start2 end2)

(substringCiNE text1 start1 end1 text2 start2 end2)

Argument.Name: string1
Argument.Note: The first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: start1
Argument.Note: The beginning position of the first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: end1
Argument.Note: The ending position of the first String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: string2
Argument.Note: The second String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: start2
Argument.Note: The beginning position of the second String or Text to be compared

Argument.Name: end2
Argument.Note: The ending position of the second String or Text to be compared

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the substrings are not equal, and false if the substrings are equal.
